pros: To say this is a great place to work sounds cliché' but its true. There is overwhelming support and mutual respect from the top down. A genuine care not only for the community it serves but, also the employees. The orientation and on-boarding process is extremely top-notch. Not only are you provided up-front knowledge and hands-on experience from the beginning, it is reinforced throughout the year with various educational offerings.  The company invest well in their employees and subsequently, benefit all by promoting from within. Hospice is a challenging and emotional area,  however, the company prides itself on its beautiful in-patient facilities making end of life experiences peaceful and a place of remembrance for the family. While I have worked for many companies in my career,   my only regret is not starting at this one sooner. It feels good to come to work everyday, associate with such great people and provide comfort and support to our patients and families in need.
cons: If I think long and hard, I can only say "I love the company".

pros: I worked for HPCCR for 12 years and can honestly say this organization is the best Hospice in Charlotte. All the staff are so caring and dedicated to patients and community. As a non profit HPCCR never denies service based on patients ability to pay. They go above and beyond what is required in a Hospice provider. HPCCR has starred in 1978 and is the largest and best provider in the region. I have never worked anywhere else that gave me so much support and personal rewards. They are truly a family.  Case managers have many responsibilities and autonomy. To be a great Hospice nurse is a calling. It is not just a job.
cons: I could have made more money perhaps working for a hospital but the rewards far outweighed the difference in pay.
